content:
As an AI language model, I do not have access to real-time information and news. However, I can provide you with some information about the past restoration of the Alcazaba in Málaga.

In 2012, a restoration project was initiated to preserve and restore the Palacio de los Nazaríes, also known as the Nazrid Palace, that had suffered damage in a 19th-century bomb explosion. The project included the restoration of the palace's frescoes, tile work, and intricate wooden ceilings.

In 2020, a project was initiated to restore and preserve the Islamic-Andalusian gardens located within the Alcazaba complex. The project aimed to rehabilitate the gardens, repair the retaining walls, and improve the irrigation system using traditional techniques.

Additionally, ongoing preservation efforts, including conservation, restoration, and maintenance work, are carried out regularly at the Alcazaba to ensure the preservation of its heritage and design.
